newsitem.title: UK: Nationwide says UK house prices up 0.4% in April.
newsitem.headline: Nationwide says UK house prices up 0.4% in April.

text.p: released the following UK house price data -
HOUSE PRICES (index base Q1 1983=100) April March April,96

NOTE - The Nationwide said while UK prices continue to rise, this is largely due to strong rises on the south. The level of property transactions, although around 50 percent up on its trough in the south east for example, remains low by historical standards.
"Although the general election may have reduced demand slightly, the main limiting factor on activity seems to be supply," said Paul Sanderson, Nationwide's head of research.
He said severe shortages of quality property continued to be responsible for the bulk of current price rises with a number of buyers competing for any suitable property.
